text: A must visit if you are transmitting through Singapore.  A great place to refresh yourself before your next flight.  All the team here we're friendly and helpful.  The pool area was well laid out with plenty of seating and sun beds.  What let's it down is the following.  In the men's changing room a lot of the lockers were broken so there was nowhere to store our luggage.  When we came to take a shower after swimming there was no hot water so had to take cold showers.  Also the cocktail I ordered was really poor.  If you going to charge 20 Singapore dollars for a mojito it has to be spot on but it was just very ordinary.  It wouldn't stop me from visiting again but forewarned if forearmed.

If you have a long afternoon or early evening stopover, this is a very relaxing option.  Enjoyed a beer and Tom Yum, bit of a swim, and then just zoned out.   You have a nice pool and can see the planes taxiing in the background.

Expensive - both entrance fee and drinks. But a refreshing activity to pass a longer stopover - pun intended. Beats lounges. Disappointing: the opening hours. Only starts to operate from around 12pm. Why ist that? An airport like this is busy around the clock and people certainly up for a swim in the morning hours, too. Not interested in more business?
Overpriced. Pool was dirty & food wasnâ€™t worth the money.
